key_facts: RAG stands for Real-time Audio-Video Group, a type of service that enables group video conferencing and screen sharing.
RAG services are typically used for remote meetings, online training sessions, and team collaboration.
Many popular chat clients, such as Slack and Discord, offer RAG capabilities to facilitate seamless communication.

main_concepts.name: Real-time Audio-Video
main_concepts.definition: Refers to the simultaneous transmission of audio and video signals over the internet in real-time, allowing for interactive and immersive communication experiences.

main_concepts.name: Group Video Conferencing
main_concepts.definition: A type of conferencing that enables multiple users to participate in a virtual meeting simultaneously, often with screen sharing capabilities.

relationships: The Real-time Audio-Video concept is closely related to Group Video Conferencing as it provides the foundation for facilitating interactive and immersive group meetings.
RAG services are also related to other important concepts such as Cloud Computing, Data Storage, and Network Infrastructure, which enable the smooth operation of these services.
potential_sections: Technical Requirements: A section exploring the technical specifications and requirements needed to run a successful RAG service, including bandwidth, processing power, and compatibility.
Use Cases: A section highlighting various use cases for RAG services, such as virtual training sessions, team meetings, and online events, showcasing their versatility and applications.
